column1: When the observer lived here it was a school and he was the headmaster. He had 2 gauges, one on the lawn, the other in a viewing tower built by the previous owner.
It is currently a hotel 250 yrds N of station
Given elevation of 140ft a little high
From May 1874 to Feb 1876 a gauge made on the island was used. From 12th Feb 1876 a Met Office gauge was used.
The old gauge was kept beside the new one for 6 months and the difference was very slight
